page.title: 07An afternoon Out
page.content: On wednesday the 26th June 1985, we were going to North Weald Air Field. When we got there we saw the Catalina which was a big South African plane. It had never been to England before. It was very big and it had to go very fast when it was taking off. Some photographers were interviewing Gary Numan who is a pop star and has his own plane. Later he was in a dog fight with a Corsair. Then Gary landed and there was a wooden model of Gary's plane on the side of the grass. The corsair tried to shoot Gary's plane but the 1st time he missed the second time he shot is and there was all black smoke everywhere. A bit of it was on fire so the fire engine had to come and put the fire out. Some men set some bombs off by remote control. It was very frightening as we didnt expect it.
